H0.text: Digestive is the system in which foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms.

H1.text: Respiratory is the system in which foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms.

H2.text: Circulatory is the system in which foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms.

H3.text: Skeletal is the system that foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms in.

A4.text: Coeliac disease is an autoimmune disorder of the small intestine. This can cause vitamin deficiencies due to the improper absorption of nutrients in the small intestine.

A5.text: A number of problems including malnutrition and anemia can arise from malabsorption, the abnormal absorption of nutrients in the GI tract.
